result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Ryan Watkins

records.addlTxt:
3:22 PM Defendant James Ryan Watkins in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for James Ryan Watkins.  Attorney Kathryn Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter appears by ZOOM.
Court calls cases 21CM98 and 22CM32.
Court reviews plea forms previously filed.
ADA heard on agreement.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 21CM98.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Christensen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1 of 21CM98.
Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 21CM98.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 22CM32.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Christensen heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1 of 21CM98:
1 year jail, with good time and huber release, and places Deft on probation for 2 years.
Credit for 7 days time served.
Conditions of probation:
Payment of $300 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $868.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription.
Must take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed.
No entrance into any bars or taverns whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
May dine at a restaurant that serves alcohol, but may not sit at the bar and anyone sitting at the table may not have alcohol.
AODA and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent or treating professional at the VA.
Must participate in some type of group program.
Obtain a certificate of completion of safety course pursuant to 30.74(1).
DNA sample due 08-22-2022.
Appeal rights.
4:00 PM

3:02 PM Defendant James Ryan Watkins in court.  Attorney Robert Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for James Ryan Watkins. 
Court calls cases 21CM98 and 22CM32.
Atty Christensen heard - deft will be applying for the Mental Health Court.
Deft has recently obtained his medical records from the VA.
Atty Christensen will be submitting the application to the Mental Health Court today.
Court schedules with parties.
3:05 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 03:25 pm.
Dean Apt Atty Christiansen; Repayment @ $200/month Comm 3/7/2022.

Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
